ratings.comment: Very very bad class, even worse professor. Retained almost nothing because almost nothing was discussed. Unfortunately, he is too old to teach effectively. the most arrogant professor I've had, you cannot even ask questions

I want to start out by saying he is a very nice guy, but Professor Krainer is by far the worst professor I've had. He came to lecture late half the time and when he did start lecture, he was super disorganized and never knew where he was in his slide deck. Also, he was one of the most arrogant professors that I've had and is ver close-minded.
He is the worst professor I've had at UW-Madison. Doesn't know how to communicate, can't answer questions, is too old to be teaching. Avoid this professor if you can.

I dropped the class within 20 days and usually am not one to post about a professor, but for this one its worth it. Worst professor Ive had at UW Madison in general. You will not know a single thing that is going on in the class. Not sure how he is still allowed to lecture this class. STRONGLY ADVISE TO STAY AWAY FROM THIS COURSE

The entire course is based on 3 exams and a couple take home quizzes. The exams are all open note so if you prepare a good study guide you will be set! He is a boring lecturer but provides a booklet with all of the information you will need for the exams, so attendance is not necessary.

Krainer is a straight G. Super old and boring, but his exams are almost word for word in the readings and slides. Open note exams. I skipped about half lectures and did fine so if you have a choice to take this for your FIN elective, take him. Make a table of contents for the exams to find stuff quickly and you should get an A for sure.

Everything bad about him in these comments are true. It is the worst class I have taken at the Business school. I feel as if I have been robbed of my tuition money for taking such pointless class with a professor that is one step away from a nursing home.
Robs the man. Straight up G, cash money.

This man is a genius. He knows his stuff and has done more research than many of the professors Ive had. He is a terrible professor though. Cant hear questions you ask, doesnt really cover whats on the exams. Exams are difficult and there are only two which make up most of your grade. Open note, but that doesnt help much. Uses old school ways.
This class is awful. Very lecture heavy and the are incredibly difficult to follow. The professor is a smart guy, but is clueless on how to teach. Take another class if you can!
I would rate the man a 0 if I could. Absolutely awful instructor.

If you are reading this before it is too late to drop the class you are in luck.  If you are reading it after you are realizing how horrible it is, sorry.  Drop this class before it is too late.  You will learn nothing and will hate yourself for trying to "just get through it."  Do not take it!  You have been warned.

Dr. Krainer is very smart and knows what he is talking about. That being said, DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! SERIOUSLY! This is an unbearable class where you will learn nothing and have to prepare for a test that you really can not study for since you learned nothing.  You literally have to search for the answer in the notes you know nothing about.

The fact that he is still teaching this class amazes me. Yes, he is smart and has done a lot of research. But none of that means anything if he can't transfer that knowledge to students and actually teach us something. It takes 75 minutes of him rambling to get through 6 slides that could've been summarized in 10 minutes. Take econ class instead.
Classes are god-awful... Worst professor I've had in business school.

Krainer is very knowledgeable but honestly is too old to teach. He cannot hear very well and does not have a clue how to answer questions that are asked in lecture. Course workload is extremely minimal but I feel like I have learned absolutely nothing. You entire grade basically depends on two tests (which are open note).

Professor Krainer is one of those professors who exudes a sense of aloofness and disinterest. Any question that is asked, is responded to in a derogatory manner. His lectures are very difficult to follow because it is a random mess of incoherent powerpoints slides. Be warned that you will not be given a warm welcome if you go to his office.

Open book final and midterm with take home quizzes. The class is laid back, but you have to attend lecture to pass. He provides his own packet of notes ($20). Incredibly smart prof, but confusing on what will be covered on exam. Write really good notes and organize everything before exams. Know where everything is in your notes packet.

Easy class if you go to class. Skim the readings for more clarity. He's hard to follow in the beginning and seems like he's not talking about anything but he is insanely good at what he does. Open book mid-term and finals with take-home quizzes are pretty easy if you have everything from class written down. Gives you class notes.

repeatedly covered the same material and after each time I came away with something completely different. haha. Overall class should not be hard, but professor didn't have any sense of what material was important or what to emphasize for tests.

I think the class was fine actually. Only a midterm and a final. Both were open books. It wouldn't be hard to get a good grade as long as you go to class and take notes carefully. Classes were hard to follow at the beginning, but get more organized when he began to talk about his theory. Only a little content, Manageable. Pretty laid-back classes.

Krainer is by far the worst professor that I have had at the university. The readings are pointless, and lecture consists of him rambling on about his theories on how to fix the financial system. Exams are open book, but there are questions on the exams that cover material never mentioned in lecture. I highly recommend AVOIDING this class.
Impossible to follow. Lecture slides are completely useless. There is absolutely nothing to gain from his lecturing. Avoid if possible.

Easy class if you know where everything is in the book and the notes he gives you.  Open book tests.  Second much harder than the first.  Debates are useless.  This class requires a very low amount of work to get a good grade.

Absolute joke. The topics he covers shouldn't be hard, but his incomprehensible rambling makes the class impossible to follow. First midterm entailed copying of the notes he gives to you, while the second midterm had topics never discussed on it. Group "debates" are pointless and the final is questions about the debates. He is the worst prof EVER!

Awful professor...rambles a lot and repeatedly covers the same material. He's also an incredibly boring lecturer. Readings are worthless. His theories also don't make sense. Dropped the class after he announced the day before the midterm that it would cover a 60-page reading that was not previously assigned or discussed..I couldn't take it anymore.

Not great by any means, but there are definitely much worse professors within the business school. As long as you go to class and take down everything that he says at face value, you usually can do pretty well. You can question what he says, but it seems like it goes best for everyone to just let him talk. Tests not that difficult,so you'll be fine

This is the absolute worst class I have ever taken by far. Krainer solely preaches his theories because we are FORCED to listen to. He is the worst teacher at the University and its a joke that they even allow him to teach here at Madison, much less a class that is a part of the finance major. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.
Krainer teaches his theories on the banking system and they make absolutely nos sense. He provides no help and has often gotten mad when students have asked for examples.
Great professor, just go to his class and take notes on what he talks about and you wont need his book filled with articles. Take good notes on current events.
The guy is very nice but the class is hard because he doesn't really teach anything that shows up on it. The book is put together by him and is barely helpful.
